After his bad behaviour on dates and seemingly backwards attitude towards women captured the nation's attention, Stephen Bear finally got his comeuppance on Thursday night's Celebs Go Dating . 
Following the decision on Monday night not to invite him to the final boys' mixer, the 27-year-old Ex On The Beach star was given a dressing down by dating agency bosses Nadia and Eden, which ended with him being given his marching orders for becoming involved with Charlotte Crosby. 
Called in to explain himself, Bear was unrepentant throughout the awkward chat, as he was told there wasn't "even a glimmer of hope" for him staying at the agency. Read More Celebs Go Dating's Ferne McCann has VERY awkward encounter with disaster date Lee - and viewers can't deal with it Bear was FINALLY given the axe on Celebs Go Dating, on Wednesday (Photo: Channel 4) 
As he continued to chirp away with cheap shots in diary room shots, he sat in front of Nadia and Eden like a naughty schoolboy as he was given a dressing down for "undermining" the whole business. 
Declaring that he was "110%" single, Nadia called Stepehen out on his relationship with Charlotte, telling him: "We've seen from your social media that you are dating someone outside the agency!" 
Refusing to own up to the secret, he laughed at Nadia and said: "You can throw out wild accusations all you want," but Nadia wasn't having any of it and shouted: "It's all over the press and it's all over social media!" Read More Charlotte Crosby left 'fuming' after letting Stephen Bear give her a TATTOO In an awkward final confrontation with Nadia and Eden he remained unrepentant (Photo: Channel 4) 
Confronted with the chopping block, the reality show favourite declared that he'd "tried my best" throughout the process, which caused an annoyed Eden to list a number of shocking things he'd put various women through on the show. 
As Eden told him they couldn't work with him because he was putting up a wall, narrator Rob Beckett summed up Bear's problem on the show, as he quipped he'd put up a wall of "bulls*** and hair gel". 
Giving him their full permission to "hook-up" with whoever he wanted, Bear was told that the agency would no longer be working with him. Taking non of it seriously, he continued to joke throughout the tense meeting (Photo: Channel 4) 
"Brilliant, now I'm sacked," he sulked as Nadie and Eden washed their hands with him, but as he headed for the door he couldn't resist one last shot at Nadia. 
The dramatic ending to the would-be Casanova's time on the show came after he was seen admitting he was actually involved with a girl outside of the show on Monday. 
This was something which led to Nadia deciding it was time to get rid of her problem client (sort of) - though she wasn't going to do the dirty work.
